text:
My heart goes out to the three brave firefighters injured while trying to stop the Calf Canyon/ Hermit’s Peak Fire. Thank you for your service and for protecting our communities from these devastating wildfires.

https://t.co/nzm5hepbtb

I welcome @POTUS’ visit to northern NM. He can meet our families and communities who’ve lost so much. I will discuss our bill to compensate all those who’ve lost homes, businesses, and livelihood to the devastating fires started by the prescribed burns.
My office will be hosting wildfire assistance office hours on Wednesday, June 15, from 11:30 a.m. - 1:00 p.m., MT in Taos. https://t.co/o5Rc003xu8

Clearly, USFS needs to enact substantive reforms to ensure accountability and restore trust in their use of prescribed burns. My Hermit’s Peak Fire Assistance Act will provide compensation from these prescribed fires, but we must also protect our forests. (2/2)

It is outrageous that USFS started both the Calf Canyon and Hermit’s Peak Wildfires. I called for an independent federal investigation so that no other community in NM or the U.S. suffers the destruction we have seen from these catastrophic wildfires.(1/2) My statement below  ⇩ https://t.co/Q8zKQuDNiF

On National Gun Violence Awareness Day, we remember the victims of gun violence in New Mexico and across the nation. Let’s honor their lives, stand together against gun violence, and keep our communities safe. #EndGunViolence #WearOrange #NationalGunViolenceAwarenessDay https://t.co/kHPnTJdL0n

June is #GunViolenceAwarenessMonth. There have already been over 200 mass shootings in the United States THIS YEAR. 

Every day 30 Americans are killed by someone using a gun. 

The number is over 100 for suicide and accidents. 

Let's commit to #EndGunViolence https://t.co/19pQp37np0

June is #NationalOceanMonth. The oceans connect us worldwide, sustain countless marine lives, provide jobs, and supply us with food. Yet, with rising sea levels and increased acidity, our oceans are in trouble – let’s protect this precious resource. 💙🌊

Today is the last day to apply to the Critical Needs Assistance program that provides $500 for eligible impacted households to cover immediate needs as we continue to address this wildfire. https://t.co/LPoJcKLoJQ

Somos una nación de inmigrantes. En el #ImmigrantHeritageMonth, honremos las contribuciones de los inmigrantes de nuestra nación, y juntos mejoremos nuestro sistema de inmigración.  
#CelebremosNuestrosInmigrantes #TúNoEresOlvidado

We are a nation of immigrants. On #ImmigrantHeritageMonth, let's honor the contributions of our nation's immigrants, and together, let's fix our broken immigration system. #CelebrateImmigrants #YouAreNotForgotten

Today we begin Alzheimer's and Brain Awareness Month. We need to support dementia policy priorities and raise awareness about early-stage Alzheimer’s. 
Go Purple, and let's support the fight to end Alzheimer's! 
#GoPurple #ENDALZ

Gun violence is an epidemic in the United States, and every day 30 people are killed by someone using a gun. That number jumps to over 100 when you factor in suicides and accidental deaths. We must remember the human toll that gun violence takes. #EndGunViolence
June 1st is LGBTQ+ Families Day. Let’s celebrate the LGBTQ+ families across New Mexico, the United States, and the World! #LGBTQFamiliesDay https://t.co/nlNKPGkvUQ

June 1 marks the start of Pride Month!
Let's celebrate the LGBTQ+ community and the progress made towards equality. But, let's not forget that there is still much to do. I will never stop fighting for LGBTQ+ Equality. #LoveIsLove #PrideMonth 
❤🧡💛💚💙💜 https://t.co/Uwn8lhnTlL
